events.title: APAC Cost Control Program Implementation
events.summary: The APAC cost control program aims to reduce operating expenses by 12% by the end of the quarter without compromising service integrity or security posture. The program includes hiring freezes, reduced contractor hours, and procurement constraints.
evidence: 12% reduction in APAC operating expense by quarter end
hiring freeze for APAC Support and IT Ops roles

events.title: Increased Cloud and Infrastructure Costs
events.summary: APAC cloud spend has risen due to peak-hour headroom, retry traffic, and extended on-call coverage. Several planned reliability upgrades are scheduled for this quarter, which may reduce long-term risk but increase near-term costs.

events.title: Customer Support Load and Productivity
events.summary: Support-related costs are above plan due to ticket volume growth and longer handling times for complex categories. Average first response time has shown early signs of deterioration during peak hours.

events.title: Revenue and Acquisition Efficiency
events.summary: Revenue has remained broadly flat week-over-week, while customer acquisition cost (CAC) in APAC has increased relative to the previous month, indicating reduced marketing efficiency.

events.title: Financial Objective and Measurement
events.summary: The financial objective is to reduce APAC operating expense by 12% by quarter end without increasing customer-impact incidents or security risk. Performance will be tracked across four categories: spend, service health, customer experience, and risk posture.

events.title: Approved Cost-Control Actions
events.summary: Approved cost-control actions include hiring and staffing controls, procurement constraints, and project deferrals. These actions are effective immediately and will be reviewed weekly.

events.title: Guardrails and Decision Triggers
events.summary: Guardrails are in place to ensure that cost reduction does not compromise service integrity, security posture, or customer communication. Decision triggers will automatically prioritize service continuity over cost reduction if certain conditions are met.

events.title: Implementation Timeline
events.summary: The implementation timeline includes immediate actions, stabilization, and quarterly review. The program will be reviewed weekly, and decisions will be made based on performance metrics and leading indicators.

events.title: High Volume of App Slow/Laggy Tickets
events.summary: The APAC region experienced a high volume of 'App slow/laggy' tickets, with 5587 tickets and an average first response time of 74.85 minutes. The average sentiment score for this topic was 0.567.
evidence: Average first response time of 74.85 minutes for 'App slow/laggy' tickets
Average sentiment score of 0.567 for 'App slow/laggy' tickets

events.title: Long Average First Response Time for Trade/Order Stuck Tickets
events.summary: The 'Trade/order stuck' topic had an average first response time of 75.93 minutes, with 5109 tickets and an average sentiment score of 0.525. This topic was one of the slowest in terms of first response time.
evidence: Average first response time of 75.93 minutes for 'Trade/order stuck' tickets
Average sentiment score of 0.525 for 'Trade/order stuck' tickets

events.title: High Ticket Volume During Peak Hours
events.summary: The top ticket hour occurred on 2026-01-06T23:00:00 in the APAC region, with 54 tickets and an average first response time of 96.9 minutes. The top topic during this hour was 'App slow/laggy'.
evidence: Average first response time of 96.9 minutes during peak hour
Top topic 'App slow/laggy' during peak hour

events.title: Low Sentiment Score for Refund/Dispute Tickets
events.summary: The 'Refund/dispute' topic had an average sentiment score of 0.468, with 2597 tickets and an average first response time of 75.12 minutes. This topic had one of the lowest sentiment scores.
evidence: Average sentiment score of 0.468 for 'Refund/dispute' tickets
Average first response time of 75.12 minutes for 'Refund/dispute' tickets

events.title: Regional Ticket Distribution
events.summary: The APAC region accounted for 17587 tickets, followed by EMEA with 5153 tickets and LATAM with 2080 tickets. The APAC region had the highest ticket volume.

events.title: Average First Response Time
events.summary: The overall average first response time was 74.74 minutes, with a total of 24820 tickets. The average sentiment score was 0.573.
evidence: Average first response time of 74.74 minutes

events.title: High latency in trade-confirm service
events.summary: The trade-confirm service experienced high latency, with a p95 latency of 1699ms, exceeding the warning threshold of 1400ms.

events.title: High error rate in risk-engine service
events.summary: The risk-engine service experienced a high error rate, with an error rate of 3.05%, exceeding the warning threshold of 2.5%.

events.title: High CPU usage in dns-resolver service
events.summary: The dns-resolver service experienced high CPU usage, with a CPU usage of 85.1%, exceeding the warning threshold of 85%.

events.title: Critical latency in trade-confirm service
events.summary: The trade-confirm service experienced critical latency, with a p95 latency of 1418ms, exceeding the critical threshold of 1400ms, and a CPU usage of 89.1%, exceeding the critical threshold of 85%.

events.title: High latency in api-gateway service
events.summary: The api-gateway service experienced high latency, with a p95 latency of 2596ms, exceeding the warning threshold of 1400ms.

events.title: Critical error rate in trade-confirm service
events.summary: The trade-confirm service experienced a critical error rate, with an error rate of 2.9%, exceeding the critical threshold of 2.5%.
